title: How to Keep Your Dog Happy

steps.title: Give your pup a job for when you're gone and he is left alone.
steps.content: Give your pup a job for when you're gone and he is left alone. Dogs are bred for a specific purpose, whether it be herding or hunting, and can misbehave when these natural instincts are suppressed. [1] X Trustworthy Source American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Leading organization dedicated to the prevention of animal cruelty Go to source Create an obstacle course in which your dog follows a scent to its favorite treats. Provide him with food puzzle toys, like Kongs, to stimulate its mind. Leave him with plenty of chew toys. These will not only strengthen his jaw and teeth, but also keep him from chewing up your shoes instead. Hire a dog walker or someone to play with your pet while you’re away. Dogs that are bored are more likely to be destructive, so giving your pup things to do when you're not around will help prevent bad behavior. [2] X Expert Source Indigo Will Professional Canine Expert Expert Interview. 8 September 2020.

steps.title: Socialize your furry friend.
steps.content: Socialize your furry friend. [3] X Expert Source Jessica Powell Certified Professional Dog Trainer Expert Interview. 5 October 2021. [4] X Expert Source Osama Maghawri Professional Dog Trainer Expert Interview. 9 September 2020. Keeping it isolated or at home all day can be detrimental to his emotional well-being and create fear when it finally does come in contact with other people or dogs. But always remember to take your pup’s personality into account so you know what its limits for socializing are. [5] X Research source Take your dog on a walk, to the dog park, or set up play dates with other humans and their dogs. The goal is to get your dog used to being around other dogs. [6] X Expert Source Indigo Will Professional Canine Expert Expert Interview. 8 September 2020. Have a friend, whom your dog knows and trusts, look after your pet once a week to get it used to other people. If your dog has a cautious demeanor, introduce it to one dog at a time, and only if the other dog is calm and won't frighten your pup. [7] X Trustworthy Source Animal Humane Society Leading animal welfare nonprofit organization providing medical care, training education, and resources for animal owners Go to source

steps.title: Train your dog.
steps.content: Train your dog. [8] X Expert Source Jessica Powell Certified Professional Dog Trainer Expert Interview. 5 October 2021. This will not only increase its mental stimulation, but also strengthen the bond between you and your pooch by making your expectations for it clear. [9] X Expert Source Osama Maghawri Professional Dog Trainer Expert Interview. 9 September 2020. If you aren’t sure what training would benefit your dog most, contact a Certified Pet Dog Trainer. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Establish yourself as pack leader and never waiver.
steps.content: Establish yourself as pack leader and never waiver. It’s important to show your dog love and affection, but he is a tribal animal above all else. Your pooch will become confused without structure and consistency in his life, so be sure you stick to your role. [11] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source Playtime is only for when he is calm and receptive. Reward your pup with special treats when it has followed your directions. During walks your dog should be next to or behind you.

steps.title: Remain calm and assertive around your dog.
steps.content: Remain calm and assertive around your dog. Never behave uneasy or anxious. Because you are the pack leader, these feelings are sure to rub off on your pet. Nervous animals are more likely to be aggressive. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Maintain your dog’s confidence.
steps.content: Maintain your dog’s confidence. Believe it or not, your pup does have self-esteem, and there are things that you, as its owner, can do to keep it up. Praise your dog when it has mastered a new trick, along with other accomplishments. Remember that your tone of voice is the key to communication with your pet; praise for him should sound different than a command. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Keep your pup active.
steps.content: Keep your pup active. Especially if it is alone all day, a dog needs exercise just like people do. [14] X Expert Source Osama Maghawri Professional Dog Trainer Expert Interview. 9 September 2020. [15] X Expert Source Jessica Powell Certified Professional Dog Trainer Expert Interview. 5 October 2021. Take your dog on a walk around the block or play a fun, interactive game with it. [16] X Research source Hide and seek will stimulate your pet’s mind and body. If you have a high-energy breed, your dog could benefit from an agility class, which may be offered through your local shelter. A puppy is especially precocious, so active games like tug-of-war and fetch will burn some energy and help to socialize him. [17] X Research source For an older dog with stiff joints, water activities are a safe, low impact source of exercise. If you have a small dog, consider finding a dog park that has specified areas where your pet can socialize with pup's his own size and temperament so you don't have to be skeptical of his safety.

steps.title: Feed your dog a nourishing, balanced diet.
steps.content: Feed your dog a nourishing, balanced diet. An animal is happiest when it can exercise, and to do so, it must eat healthful food. What you feed your pooch depends on his age, energy level and potential allergies. Organic, grain-free kibble is always best if you are going to go the commercial route. However, some veterinarians also swear by feeding dogs “people food”. Dog-approved people foods include: Raw, unsalted peanut butter Baby carrots Pumpkin Green beans Sliced apples Oatmeal [18] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source

steps.title: Schedule regular veterinary appointments for your pet.
steps.content: Schedule regular veterinary appointments for your pet. The vet will provide an overall health screening, as well as any vaccinations your dog might need. It's best for puppies and older dogs to visit every six months, while once a year is adequate for adult dogs under the age of ten. [19] X Research source This visit can also help you determine methods for keeping your dog’s ears and teeth clean, along with any other hygiene concerns.

steps.title: Ensure your dog’s safety at all times.
steps.content: Ensure your dog’s safety at all times. This includes making sure it has an ID tag on it, a fenced yard that will keep it safe from potential predators, and plenty of shade and water if it’s outside during warm weather. Make sure your dog is securely fastened or confined during car trips and never let its head hang out of the window where he could be hit by airborne objects or thrown from the vehicle. [20] X Research source Unless your dog is extremely well-trained, leashing him when outside the yard is important, especially if you’re in a high-traffic area. Kids should always be supervised around a dog; young children should also never be allowed to hold a small dog as they can accidentally drop or injure him. [21] X Trustworthy Source American Kennel Club The American Kennel Club (AKC) is a purebred dog pedigree registry in the United States. The AKC advocates for the responsible ownership of dogs and promotes purebred dog events, such as the Westminster Dog Show. Go to source

steps.title: Give your pup regular massages.
steps.content: Give your pup regular massages. This will bring down his stress levels and soothe any joint pain it may be experiencing. A slow rub down that reaches the muscle, fat and bones can work wonders to calm a nervous dog. Daily massages can prolong the length and quality of your canine’s life. Rubbing your dog’s joints can prepare him for physical activity and help him to unwind directly after. [22] X Research source Great Danes and Mastiffs are especially prone to arthritis, so aside from a daily massage, nutritional supplements can be considered to keep these breeds healthy and pain-free. [23] X Research source

steps.title: Be sure to brush, comb, and trim your Golden Retriever’s coat regularly.
steps.content: Be sure to brush, comb, and trim your Golden Retriever’s coat regularly. Golden Retrievers are especially prone to allergies and matting of their thick coats. Keeping its fur clean will prevent its skin from getting itchy and also better serve as insulation during the hot summer and cold winter. [24] X Research source As a bonus, it won’t shed quite as much on your furniture. Pay special attention to the feathering of his tail and legs which can get tangled easily, causing your Golden discomfort.

steps.title: Set aside at least two hours a day to give your Pitbull attention.
steps.content: Set aside at least two hours a day to give your Pitbull attention. While this breed is known for its loyalty and devotion, it needs a lot of quality time with you so he doesn’t get bored and destructive. The high-energy Pitbull isn’t the type you can leave alone or put outside for the entire day. This athletic breed enjoys swimming, running, playing fetch or frisbee, along with most other sports. Because it is a social butterfly, a well-trained Pitbull appreciates human interaction, including time with your friends, family and even strangers, so be sure to get it out of the house. [25] X Expert Source Osama Maghawri Professional Dog Trainer Expert Interview. 9 September 2020.

steps.title: Keep your Chihuahua warm in cold or wet weather.
steps.content: Keep your Chihuahua warm in cold or wet weather. This must be taken seriously since the Chihuahua, like some other small breeds, has trouble regulating its own body temperature, and doesn’t have a large amount of insulating fur. [26] X Research source A Chihuahua is generally content to be cuddled up on its owners lap, both for affection and warmth. Investing in a sweater for your Chihuahua will help keep him from shivering when he's outside.

steps.title: Be sure your terrier has toys with which to entertain himself, especially when left alone.
steps.content: Be sure your terrier has toys with which to entertain himself, especially when left alone. While a terrier is a fairly independent dog, it does require a fair amount of exercise. This dog doesn't require your supervision all day as long as you give it the means to play safely on his own. [27] X Research source If your terrier is left with nothing to occupy itself, it may resort to digging or other destructive forms of entertainment. It is especially fond of other canine companionship and playtime can be beneficial for socializing terrier breeds.
